p: Rather than acting as phytoestrogens, sesame lignans pinoresinol and matairesinol exerted moderate antiestrogen activity in yeast strain expressing estrogen receptor fused to a reporter [ 309]. Because the concentrations of pinoresinol in sesame oil are lower than the concentrations of estrogenic lignans, and matairesinol only occurs in traces ( Table 1), these antiestrogenic effects do not appear relevant for human nutrition.
